#Text=2. Information Entropy of Sub-Band Image
#Text=2.1. Application of the Discrete Wavelet Transform ( DWT )
#Text=Wavelet transform is an effective tool to combine time domain and frequency domain .
#Text=In most applications , discrete signals are used .
#Text=Therefore , discrete wavelet transform ( DWT ) must be used instead of continuous wavelet transform .
#Text=Wavelet transform can decompose the signal by band-pass filter .

#Text=The result of the band filtering operation will be two different signals , one will be related to the high frequency components and the other related to the low frequency component of the original signal .

#Text=To compute the DWT of an image of size , it must identify the wavelet scale function to define the approximation coefficients and the wavelet function responsible for horizontal , vertical and diagonal coefficients following the equations below : ( 1 ) ( 2 ) with : ( 3 ) ( 4 ) where is the start resolution and the scale parameter j is always greater or equal to .
#Text=In general , we choose and in order that and .
#Text=2.2. Calculation of Information Entropy
#Text=After an image is transformed by wavelet , a series of sub-band images with different resolutions can be obtained .
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=shows the results of a Barbara image with a size of 512 × 512 decomposed by two layers of wavelets .
#Text=The upper leftmost part of each layer in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=is a low-frequency image , and the upper right , lower left , and upper right corners are the vertical high-frequency , horizontal high-frequency , and diagonal sub-band images , respectively .
#Text=The second layer decomposes the low-frequency image of the first layer into a low-frequency sub-band image ( upper left corner in
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=) and a high-frequency sub-band image in the vertical , horizontal , and diagonal directions .
#Text=Subsequently , the third layer wavelet transform repeats this process to continue to decompose the low-frequency image of the second layer , and the like .
#Text=The above evaluation shows that the multiscale analysis of wavelet transform can efficiently describe the global and local information of the image .

#Text=Generally , a low-frequency image reflects the global information of the entire image , but a high-frequency sub-band image reflects the local details , such as edge , contour , and other image areas with mutations .
#Text=Therefore , this section calculates the corresponding information entropy of each wavelet sub-band image on the basis of the information of multiple directions .

#Text=Then , each information entropy is used as the visual quality weight of the corresponding sub-band image to describe the effects of different sub-band images on the quality of the entire image .
#Text=The calculation process of information entropy is summarized as follows :

#Text=Distorted image I is imput , and S-layer wavelet decomposition is performed for distorted image to obtain low-frequency , horizontal , vertical , and diagonal sub-band images , denoted as , , , and , respectively .
#Text=Then , each sub-band image is divided into image sub-blocks that do not overlap , and the information entropy of each sub-block is calculated .
#Text=Finally , the average information entropy of all sub-blocks is obtained and used as the visual content weight of the cost function .
#Text=The number of layers S of the wavelet decomposition is set to 1 .
#Text=The information entropy of each sub-block is calculated as follows : ( 5 ) where denotes the probability of wavelet coefficient appearing in the sub-block image , and .
#Text=represents the wavelet coefficients of the sub-block image , is the number of all wavelet coefficients of each sub-block image .
#Text=Generally , information entropy reflects the intensity of image information to a certain extent .
#Text=The larger the information entropy of an image , the larger the amount of information , and the better the visual quality of the image .
#Text=Moreover , the information entropy of the image includes rich structural information , which can be used to measure the sensitivity of the local image .
#Text=Therefore , people are inclined to evaluate the visual quality of images from areas with high acuity .
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=presents the information entropy map of the low-frequency and three high-frequency sub-band images after the wavelet transform of Barbara image .
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=also shows the large amount of structural information and the distribution of the information entropy , which is close to the image area of human visual perception .
#Text=Therefore , the wavelet information entropy of the image can be used as the visual weight to improve the subjective and objective consistencies of the image quality evaluation .
